text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Valparaíso Region | native_name = Región de Valparaíso | native_name_lang = es | settlement_type = Region of Chile | seat_type = Capital | seat = Valparaíso | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | parts_type = Provinces | parts = Petorca, Los Andes, San Felipe de Aconcagua, Quillota, Quilpué, Valparaíso, San Antonio, | leader_title = Intendant | leader_name = Jorge Martínez Durán | leader_party = RN | image_skyline = Cerro Tres Hermanos.jpg | image_caption = Nevado Juncal | image_flag = Flag of Valparaiso Region, Chile.svg | flag_size = 120px | flag_alt = Flag of Valparaíso Region | image_shield = Coat of arms of Valparaiso Region, Chile.svg | shield_size = 75px | shield_alt = Coat of Arms of Valparaíso Region | image_map = Valparaiso in Chile (+outer islands).svg | mapsize = 250px | map_caption = Map of Valparaíso Region | area_total_km2 = 16396.1 | area_footnotes = | area_rank = 13 | elevation_min_footnotes = | elevation_max_footnotes = | elevation_max_m = | elevation_min_m = 0 | population_total = 1790219 | population_as_of = 2017 census | population_footnotes = | population_rank = 2 | population_density_km2 = auto | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2019) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.867 | website = Official website | iso_code = CL-VS | footnotes = }} The Valparaiso Region () is one of Chile's 15 first order administrative divisions. The capital of the region is the city of Valparaiso, an important Chilean seaport. Other important cities are Viña del Mar, Quillota, Quilpué and Villa Alemana. ==History== Valparaíso was made a province in 1842. In January 1928, Valparaíso was made part of the new province of Aconcagua but in 1936 was made again a province. In 1974, with the creation of the Regions of Chile, Valparaíso became one of the Chilean regions. ==Geography== The Valparaíso region borders the Coquimbo region to the north, Argentina and Santiago Metropolitan Region on the east, the Santiago Metropolitan Region region on the south, the O'Higgins region on the southwestern and the Pacific Ocean on the west. The three main rivers are: * Petorca, long. * La Ligua, long. * Aconcagua, long. ==Population== , there were (estimated) 1,825,757 persons living in the region, for a population density of inhabitants/km². The largest city in the region is Viña del Mar, with 286, 931 inhabitants (2002 census). The capital of the region, Valparaíso, had in 2002 263,499 inhabitants. ==Administration== The Valparaíso region is divided in eight provinces: Valparaíso Region - Provinces and comunas Provinces
